data.title: David Warbeck Movies and Shows
data.meta_description: Learn about David Warbeck on Apple TV. Browse shows and movies that feature David Warbeck including The Beyond, Rat Man, and more.
data.text: David Warbeck was an actor who made a successful career for himself in film. Warbeck had an early acting career in film, appearing in such titles as the Romy Schneider dramatic adaptation "My Lover, My Son" (1970), the Joan Crawford sci-fi flick "Trog" (1970) and the Madeleine Collinson horror flick "Twins of Evil" (1972). He also appeared in "Sweet Suzy" (1973). He had a part on the television special "Only a Scream Away" (ABC, 1973-74). He worked in series television while getting his start in acting, including a part on "U.F.O." (1972-73). He continued to work steadily in film throughout the seventies and the eighties, appearing in "The Sex Thief" (1974), "E Tu Vivrai Net Terrore! L'Aldilla" (1980) and "The Black Cat" (1980). He also appeared in "The Last Hunter" (1980), "Cacciatori del cobra d'oro" (1982) and "The Ark of the Sun God" (1983). During the latter part of his career, he continued to act in the crime feature "Lassiter" (1984) with Tom Selleck, "Formula For Murder" (1986) and "Domino" (1989). He also appeared in "Razor Blade Smile" (1998) and "The Beyond" (1998). Warbeck most recently acted in "Pervirella" (2002).
